message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the dietary preferences of animals. Lions are carnivores and their diet consists of meat, so they would eat a steak. Options (A), (C), and (D) are all herbivores and would not eat a steak.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the diet of different animals. Lions are carnivores and eat meat, so they would be the most likely animal to eat a steak. Chickens are typically herbivores or omnivores and do not commonly eat steak. Cows and buffalo are herbivores and do not eat meat. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

This question requires basic knowledge about carnivorous animals and their dietary habits. Lions are known to be carnivorous animals and their primary diet consists of meat, including steaks. Chickens, cows, and buffaloes are herbivorous animals and do not eat meat. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because chickens are herbivores. Options (C) and (D) are incorrect because cows and buffaloes are herbivores as well.
